units.title: Generation of hiPSC-derived COs at ALI
units.text: For the generation of hiPSC-derived COs cultured at the ALI, we modified a previously published method utilizing a STEMdiff Cerebral Organoid kit (StemCell Technologies, 08570). Briefly, 18,000 cells were plated in the presence of poly(lactide-co-glycolide) copolymer microfilaments to achieve improved cortical development58.
units.rationale: Describes the initial seeding and modification needed to create ALI organoids.

units.title: Media change schedule
units.text: Initially, media changes were performed at days 3, 5 and 7, then every 3–4 days.
units.rationale: Specifies the timing for routine medium replacement.

units.title: Matrigel addition for cortical plate formation
units.text: From 35 DIV onwards, Matrigel (Corning, 354234) was added in 1:50 dilution to achieve a polarized cortical plate formation.
units.rationale: Provides the step for extracellular matrix supplementation to promote cortical organization.

units.title: Long‑term ALI‑CO culture on inserts
units.text: Long-term cultures on Millicell-CM (Merck Millipore, PICM0RG50) inserts and were fed daily with slice medium containing neurobasal medium (ThermoFisher Scientific, 21103049) supplemented with 1× B27 supplement (ThermoFisher Scientific, 17504044), 0.45% (w/v) glucose (Sigma-Aldrich, G8769), Glutamax (ThermoFisher Scientific, 35050038) and 1% antibiotic–antimycotic.
units.rationale: Details the feeding regimen and medium composition for sustained organoid growth.

units.title: Fixation of slices for immunocytochemistry
units.text: Slices were fixed in 4% paraformaldehyde (PFA) for 45 min, 2 or 4 h, respectively, and washed at room temperature.
units.rationale: Defines the fixation conditions required before antibody staining.

units.title: Organoid cell dissociation
units.text: Organoid cell dissociation. For organoid cell dissociation, slices were transferred into a gentleMACS C tube (Miltenyi, 130-093-237) containing 2 ml of papain solution (20 units per ml; Worthington, PAP2) and ran on a gentleMACS Octo dissociator (Miltenyi) using the default ABDK program.
units.rationale: Outlines the enzymatic and mechanical steps to obtain single‑cell suspensions.

units.title: Alkaline comet assay for DNA damage
units.text: The alkaline comet assay was performed to compare DNA accumulation and repair in control and C9 ALS/FTD hiPSC lines60. Cells were seeded overnight before topotecan (10 μM for 1 h) treatment in the presence or absence of an ATMi (Selleck Chemicals, AZD0156, 30 nM) for 1 h.
units.rationale: Describes the experimental setup to assess DNA strand breaks and repair capacity.

units.title: ER stress induction and rescue
units.text: For ER stress induction, ALI-COs at 220 DIV were treated with 50 μM SA (Sigma-Aldrich, 1062771000) or vehicle (equal volume of slice medium). For short-term rescue experiments, slices were either pretreated with 5 μM GSK (R&D Systems, 5107/10) or vehicle overnight in inserts, followed by treatment with GSK or vehicle before SA or vehicle administration.
units.rationale: Provides the protocol for inducing ER stress and testing pharmacological rescue.

units.title: Real‑time cell vulnerability assay
units.text: Six-well plates (Appleton Woods, Corning, CC010) were coated with 1% Geltrex (Thermo Fisher Scientific, A1413302) in DMEM/F-12 (Fisher Scientific, Gibco, 11514436). hiPSCs were seeded at a density of 1 × 10^5 cells per well. After 24 h, the survival assay was performed in IncuCyte S3 Live-Cell Analysis system (Sartorius, 4647) with topotecan (1.25 nM, 2.5 nM, 5 nM or 10 nM) added and images acquired every 6 h.
units.rationale: Details the setup for longitudinal monitoring of cell survival under drug treatment.

units.title: MEA recording of spontaneous activity
units.text: ALI-COs were secured with a platinum harp onto 3D MEAs (Multi Channel Systems, MEA2100, 60–3DMEA200/12iR‑Ti‑gr, 60 electrodes, 12 μm in diameter, 200-μm spacing). Six‑minute‑long recordings of spontaneous activity at 37 °C (n = 35 ALI‑COs) were acquired and exported to Matlab for analysis.
units.rationale: Specifies the electrophysiological recording procedure to assess network activity.
